entry.et: Middle English preist, from Old English prēost, ultimately from Late Latin presbyter presbyter

def.dt: :one authorized to perform the sacred rites of a religion especially as a mediatory agent between humans and God
:an Anglican, Eastern Orthodox, or Roman Catholic clergyman ranking below a bishop and above a deacon
:a chief priest especially of the ancient Jewish Levitical priesthood traditionally traced from Aaron
:a priest of the Melchizedek priesthood in the Mormon Church
:the head of a movement or chief exponent of a doctrine or an art
:a French Roman Catholic priest who for missionary purposes spends part of each weekday as a worker in a secular job
